title: Great GP Practice
body: I've been with Boultham Park for the last 5 or so years. Getting an appointment isn't too difficult as long as you ring up at 8am and wait in the queue, but it does sometimes take a couple of attempts to get through - some people need to realise that they will have a large amount of calls to deal with which they do in a very efficient manner. If you're not in a rush for an appointment, ringing up during the day is best. I've never had an issue with any of the reception staff, nurses or doctors. All staff are extremely friendly and take the time to get to know you, and will be as helpful as they can if you have a simple query. Compared to other GPs that I've been with in the past, Boultham Park have excelled at everything from my mental health issues, to requesting a repeat prescription and arranging my first smear test. During lockdown when appointments were limited, I would receive phone calls from a GP for a quick catch up to make sure everything was okay and give me a chance to raise any concerns I had which was a really nice touch. You feel taken care of and you can tell that the staff are invested in their patients. Would highly recommend this practice, thank you Boultham Park team!

title: Bas to worst service
body:
Called in the morning to hear call after 11 am
Called after 11 am, waiting for 7th in the queue for 10 minutes to hear that call on Monday after 11 am

Do I need to waste three calls every time holding phone for 10 minutes to get to hear to call again? Ultimately  still no appointment?

On top, they say we have a bug practise with more patients so I have no identity and need to keep calling as they say for the appointment

Very non helpful staff on phone

title: Awful staff
body:
Your first receptionist/nurse that you first have to speak to, the morning of todays date in the A&E department is inconsiderate of mental conditions and needs the training to deal with us properly. The minute I get there with my other half who is with me because I suffer panic attacks and dissociation, she threatens that he will likely need to go outside. With no consideration for my mental health, I was already shaking when I got to this department. To top it off the second nurse I saw was going on and on about her lunch break to the other staff and when I tried to talk to her she was very abrupt and talking over me and maybe I would have been okay but as with the first woman, my partner was told he couldn't come in- therefore I had no emotional support. 
Just sick of this shortness and rudeness. I don't need excuses to say how bad things are with them being overworked, frankly I don't care because if they can't give a moment's compassion to someone like me, why should I give it to them? They CHOSE to work here, I did not choose to have a mental illness. Sort it out.

title: Stressful and unhelpful
body: Communication needs improvement between patient, practice and pharmacies. Ordered my repeat prescription which was approved on the app, only to find out it was rejected 4 days later when I called the practice. A doctor called me back regarding my initial phone call, they did not even introduce themselves to me and refused to put through my repeat prescription for free even though I was pregnant and therefore entitled to it. She said that I should buy it over the counter. With some persuasion, she eventually agreed to put the prescription through “just this once”. I couldn’t understand why you would be so hesitant to help a patient. Not all pregnant women are in a position to buy the medicines they need. The lack of the empathy, poor duty of care and professionalism from the doctor I spoke to was disappointing and stress-inducing.

title: Made me worse
body: Referred to EPUT services and during crisis - they refused to help me, chose to disbelieve me and not take me seriously, and made me much worse

title: good practice
body:
I received good service, whether it was an appointment, blood tests, referral, or reminder and prescriptions. 
receptions were always polite and caring.
 great staff.

title: Poor appointment system
body:
I've left this review on Google last Tuesday and subsequently direct to the practice using their own online form; but it seems that only when reported on this NHS website does the practice give a response.

The doctors do a great job, but they need to wake up to their abysmal procedure for making appointments.
The fact that appointments can only be made for the day that you phone adds stress to what is already likely to be a stressful situation. When I phoned them last Monday on behalf of my mother-in-law I would have been happy for an appointment later in the week, having been told they'd all been booked for that day, but no I was told I would instead have to phone the following day. This meant making sure I got in the telephone queue early enough to get ahead of everyone else. So I phoned at 8am the day after and was still 4 behind other callers. I was also told on my first call that completing the online form would be a quicker way of getting an appointment.
Well, I completed the online form on Monday morning, but it was because no one got back to me that I had to phone on Tuesday.
My own surgery will forward-book appointments, and that works well because most patients don't need a doctor so urgently that they have to be seen on the day they phone. The demands created by Covid-19 and staff shortages were the reasons given to me this morning for Sunbury Health Centre's current appointment process, but I know it has been like this for years previously.

title: Wonderful eye hospital.
body:
Everyone I saw treated me with great respect from the reception staff through to all the medical staff. My cataract surgery was fully explained and all my questions were answered in detail including my aftercare.
The result of my surgery is wonderful and I am hoping to have my second cataract removed shortly. I would definitely recommend SpaMedica Coventry to anyone, thank you for restoring my sight.

title: Wonderful
body: Have received wonderful care from A&E, Intensive Care, and CCU, without all of them and their care I would not be sat at home now with my family, thank you does not seem enough. THANK YOU

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Kind, professional practitioners, excellent…
body: Day-care unit, colonoscopy within the bowel cancer screening remit. Absolutely superb treatment from all concerned, great kindness from nursing staff, my dignity respected in challenging circumstances! Clear explanations, and calm, professional treatment from the surgeon. In spite of being sedated, was able to watch some of the procedure on screen, absolutely fascinating and reassuring. No discomfort during or after the procedure. Two days later, am feeling better than I have for several months. Heartfelt thanks to all concerned.

title: Safe and efficient practice
body: I was really nervous about the cataract operation but Spa Medica put me at ease and I felt safe.  The operation was very quick and efficient  I would recommend Spa Medica to anyone.

title: Extremely professional care
body: I have been taken through the A and E into the Surgical Assessment Unit (SAU) of the Manchester Royal Infirmary. The stuff of both departments did an amazing job throughout my experience in the department. It took them 4 hours (including 2 hours waiting time to see and A and E nurse, which is more then reasonable) to solve a problem my GP could not solve in a few months. The A and E nurse ensured her referral was swiftly dealt with. The SAU stuff was very friendly, reassuring, professional at all times and particularly concerned about my pain and my general experience. I was kept fully informed at all times. I can only be most grateful to the whole team. I am a foreigner, and in comparison to my home country NHS proved once again to be the best in world, at least in my eyes.

title: Caring staff.
body:
I attended ED at 3am on a Friday, the department was obviously incredibly busy and the staff were working very hard. There was a long wait for a doctor, understandably, but when I was seen, the nursing and medical staff were kind and compassionate, despite the stress they were under. I had a long stay in ED as there were no inpatient beds available, this was explained to me and staff apologised - it’s not their fault. 
I went to SAU and Brightlingsea Ward, and was operated on later that night. Everyone I came in contact with, from the porters, HCAs, nurses, to the ODPs, anaesthetists and surgeons, they were all kind and friendly, explaining everything they were doing and were incredibly reassuring... appreciated so much when you’re not allowed visitors at the moment. I recovered well on the ward post op, cared for amazingly by the Brightlingsea Ward team, and I’m now resting at home.
I’m also a nurse working at ESNEFT (not in any departments I was cared for), and appreciate the physical and emotional stress that we are all under at the moment. But no one ever made that obvious, they were all compassionate, with big smiles (beneath their masks!). I cannot thank the staff who looked after me enough, and I am so grateful for their care. A great team to work alongside, and a great team to be cared for. 
Thank you :)

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Impossible Surgery
body: Even though we are out of Lockdown it is impossible to get to see a doctor as receptionist put you off making you have to go to A & R

title: PATIENT ONLINE ACCESS REVIEW
body: Very poor experience of using this today to try and book a  telephone appointment.  I have used it successfully in the past, but this time a message is posted 'You have reached the maximum number of upcoming booked appointments at your GP practice, you cannot book more appointments online' which is totally incorrect as I have no upcoming appointments and last booked an appointment more than a year ago.  Aside the need to now have to phone for an appointment, I cannot find anywhere to report online that the information held on my file is incorrect in relation to the above and worryingly that there are two appointments I have found listed in the last two months which were definitely not mine.

title: Phone system doesn’t work
body: Called at 8am for an emergency appointment. Called over 55 times consecutively as it kept hanging up saying there was too many people on the line. Got through after 60 minutes to a call que of 6 people.  6 people it allows to que at any one time ridiculous! (This must of only changed in the last two months as used to be 30 people). Makes it so hard to get through and very time consuming. They then didn’t have any appointments as had one doctor on in the whole surgery. One doctor!!! Patients are having to go to out of hours and A&E just to see someone. Call system should be changed as clearly not working and making it increasing difficult to get through. Plus extra doctors so there’s not only one person on.

title: Great practice
body:
My husband and I were unfortunate enough to both be taken ill in December. We would both like to say how grateful we are to the 
Doctor for his help and kindness during this dreadful time. I have since dealt with the prescribing pharmacy, the nurse and the reception staff and found them charming and very helpful. Many thanks we both appreciate what you done for us both especially during this awful pandemic.

title: NHS stands for No Health Service
body: I have phoned practice on two different occasions feeling extremely low and suicidal. I was told by the receptionist that they have no emergency appointments available and was advise to call next day.  They had no appointments available at 8.10 am. I was forced to call 111 later on just to be told that my GP is obliged to see me and if they will refuse to call 999.

title: Responsive and caring practice
body: My father has recently had deteriorating health and received end of life care in the last few weeks. I cannot thank the practice enough for their responsiveness and care in the last few months and weeks. My father received wonderful care from the nurses, GPs and the wider healthcare team, and we were supported right to the end, enabling us to care for him at home, which was his, and our wish. We know the NHS is under huge pressure at the moment which makes our experience even more precious. Thank you.

title: Appointment experience
body:
I rang the practice at 8.35, and was told I was tenth on the list. Phone answered at 8.50, and after explaining the problem, was told doctor would phone me. 
The doctor rang about 9.15, and after consultation, said he needed a face to face appointment. He saw me at 11.30 the same day.
I don't think anyone could find fault with that

title: Excellent opthamology
body: I attended the ophthalmology department to follow up problems I am having with double vision. The hospital and department were clean and covid rules and regs were adhered to. You were still able to social distance despite the department being busy. I was seen promptly and the care I was given was second to none. The orthoptist was thorough and very understanding of any problems I was having and they took the time to listen. I was told I needed to see the consultant which I had to wait for but that was fine because I was kept informed every step of the way. The consultant was very empathetic and explained the new treatment I needed and answered any questions I had. Excellent treatment

title: Thank you to the Imaging Team!
body: Please pass on my thanks to the imaging department at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital re my CT scan appointment. A top notch, efficient, and human service provided by the brilliant staff there. All queries and concerns were addressed and answered courteously and comprehensively. Most impressed. Thank you again!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic care
body: The staff in acc was fantastic great care and attention ward 3 was the same great care the pacing team fantastic and my surgery staff in theatre was caring and informative only downside is the food it's terrible apart from that great hospital better then the North East

title: Better than visiting a private hospital
body:
I bought my mother to A&E have had an accident in the kitchen.  She is 90 years old and had cut her finger, fallen over and hit her head.  She was admitted to A&E, received xrays of her pelvis and hips, a head scan and referred to the frailty ward before she was eventually discharged having had her finger stitched.
I was concerned that she was on her own and had not eaten or had anything to drink.  She was given a sandwich and a drink at lunchtime and a sandwich at teatime with a cup of tea.  She could not praise the treatment and care she received more highly and nor can I.  She was dicharged with no problems, except needing her dressing changed by a district nurse.
The doctors and nurses called me to keep me updated with her progress and they could not have been more informative or helpful.  I was very impressed and most grateful for her care.
Please make sure that this gets passed to the relevant professionals who looked after, with my and my mother's thanks.

title: Useless service.
body: I went online for my husband this afternoon and was told I would be phoned back within an hour. It’s been over seven hours with no phone call.

title: Amazing staff at A&E
body:
I had to visit A&E department on Sunday night. The staff from the receptionists to nurses and doctors are extremely polite, professional and friendly.
I was particularly touched by the night nurse who gave me so much encouragement and understanding of my situation, that I felt like I was talking and looked after by my best friend. Unfortunately, in the rules for feedback was said I can’t give the name of this person and the paper forms for feedback were not available from the reception desk...
I really hope somehow this person will be recognized for her high professionalism and personal qualities like humanity and compassion. 
Tatiana

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Conflicting opinions
body: I think this ward has been outstanding. The quality of care I have received here so far has been absolutely unbelievable. The majority of the staff have been so kind and friendly and are willing to help me in any way they can. Although one thing I would say is that communication has been quite contrasting especially at times of staff hand over. I feel staff don't always keep themselves up to date and informed with every detail of a patients profile which is difficult as it means that the best quality of care is not always provided to us. For example, when speaking to the consultant on the morning ward round I was told to ensure that I kept hydrated and that I drank as much water as possible. I took this advice on board and began to drink many glasses of water, 15 minutes later a nurse came to take my blood pressure, and was questioning why I was even drinking any water as to their knowledge I should have been fasting. It's conflicting opinions such as these which confuse me as a patient and make me feel as though my care is being compromised to an extent. Overall I feel all the information which has been relayed to me by the doctor regarding my care and treatment is good and it keeps me informed as it is explained very well, I just think that staff need to make more of an effort to keep each other informed in terms of patients current conditions.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: telescopiumsq46
title: A very good experience
body:
After suffering from great pain, I called an ambulance to take me to hospital. Although I had to wait for two hours, the ambulance crew were very, very good.  
I was then taken to A&E. Overall it was a very good experience. However, I wasn't given a bed which I found a bit disappointing. The staff did all they could to look after me even though they were very busy .  
Up on the ward my experience has been a good one. All the staff are absolutely brilliant - they couldn't do enough for me. Watching the nurses run off their feet makes you realise that they don't half get payed enough and more money is needed to relieve the pressures facing all the staff members.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I felt like I was a burden in the emergency department.
body:
I came into A&E at around 4am on Monday morning and it was a nightmare. I felt like from the minute I walked through the door I was already a burden.  
The receptionist didn't seem to care about how much pain I was in, it seemed like to this member of staff I was just another number on a very long list. Staff were visibly distressed and were running around all night. The emergency department is so understaffed and under resourced it's a shambles.  
It scared me to see other patients not wearing masks and not maintaining the 2 metre social distancing rule. I felt extremely isolated, alone and scared down there for hours, not knowing what was going on. I was in so much pain and nothing was relieving it. It hit a point where I hadn't slept for a day and a half, I was just waiting and waiting and waiting to be seen. I got up and said to the receptionist that I had had enough and that I would consider writing a formal complaint as I knew my health was being compromised, it was only after this threat that staff made a huge effort to get me in straight away. After an assessment down in the waiting area and a couple of tests I was taken up to the ward 4 North.  
Now on this ward a few days I can comment on how outstanding the staff are. All members of staff just can't do enough. I am treated with respect and dignity and the staff completely empathize with how much pain I am in. My consultant has taken plenty of time to explain everything regarding my care so well and all my questions have been answered. I am extremely happy with the treatment I have received and feel like all my needs are being met.  
I am recovering on a clean ward where hygiene is outstanding. The toilet and shower facilities are first class and the food and access to water is also really good. The ward itself is big and spacious and I like how I can have some privacy if I want it via the blue curtain, but I do take many opportunities to interact with the rest of the patients on my bay, its hard to believe how close we have all become in such a short time period.  
Finally staff attitude towards their work in this ward is so inspiring to see. I feel privileged to have such a highly skilled medial and nursing team caring for me and I am looked after so well that against all odds I'm on the road to a full recovery.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: BMcniece
title: Medical Care in Craigavon Area Hospital
body:
My elderly Aunt has been in Craigavon ward 3 South for 2 weeks during the latest no visiting period. This has made it extremely difficult to find out as her NOK what is happening with her care.  
I have spoken to a nurse on the ward everyday and asked for a medical update everyday for 14 days with no one ever calling me to discuss her condition. Over the 14 days her pain has not been managed and her bloods have deteriorated and despite taking daily bloods nothing has been acted upon.  
Working for nearly 20 years in the NHS I fully appreciate the ward pressures but feel this constitutes very poor medical management and I am appalled at the lack of communication with an elderly persons NOK. I am only posting this opinion in the hope that it will mean something changes so nobody else has to receive the poor medical management and utter lack of communication that we have experienced

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: plutorc35
title: Very difficult to follow what is actually happening
body:
Ward 8A QEUH, Glasgow. Very difficult to speak to a doctor who actually knew my relative’s case. Doctors on ward and in charge of my relative changed often therefore their knowledge of him was very fragmented. We were actually given conflicting information by two different doctors regrading requirement for a CT scan. Relative moved to Gartnavel General for rehabilitation and we were assured no concerns medically, no CT scan required, just move to Gartnavel General for rehabilitation. One week after arrival at Gartnavel General, new Consultant allocated and has decided more medical tests required for the exact same condition that relative presented with 3 weeks earlier and was admitted for at QEUH yet doctor/s at QEUH had discharged my relative to Gartnavel and said there were no medical issues, only requiring rehabilitation.  
Poor communications from doctors to family about my elderly relative’s condition, very fragmented staffing and frequent changes of doctor and now also a new Consultant therefore very difficult to follow what is actually happening. Three and a half weeks spent in these two hospitals in total so far and we are no further forward in knowing what the issue is with my relative.

title: Great response
body: Telephone call and follow up actions from this out of hours doctor was  effective, pleasant and precise which the family found to be extremely reassuring - thanks so much

title: Kindest of care
body: My husband was recently admitted to Rotary Ward with a nasty post-operation infection (operation done at another hospital) and I would like to thank everyone who cared for him for the kindness and understanding he received.   He was perhaps not the easiest patient, but he was treated speedily with friendly professionalism and respect.   A big thank you to all concerned.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent maternity care and exemplary…
body:
My wife gave birth to our first son here in June of this year. Most maternity staff were exceptionally professional and supportive of my wife's choice to breastfeed, and the embedded breastfeeding support group should be regarded as the gold standard, from their interaction with new mothers in the hospital to after discharge.

The staff in the operating theatre were incredibly professional and tried their best to keep our anxiety at bay.

We also felt well looked after in ward 8F despite there being lots of other new mothers and perhaps an overstretched team. As a partner I did not feel left out or ignored, and was actively encouraged to take part to get used to being a new parent and cherish the precious first few moments with our newborn son.

You should all be very proud of the tight ship you run there at Royal London Maternity and we would certainly recommend your services to any future parents.

title: Disgraceful service
body:
Phoned at 2pm on Sunday 1st August due to increasingly swollen and painful foot and ankle, which had deteriorated over the last two days, I was told I'd hear from a duty doctor within 6 hours. 
 After 7 hours I chased the call as my foot at this point is twice the size, red and very painful and I'm certain I have a nasty infection and can barely move my ankle and foot, I was told they'd put a note on my file to call me, at this point it seems my initial call had been lost and the referral for a phonecall missed.
  A little while later I receive a text saying that my wait would be extremely lengthy as the service was so busy, followed by a call from someone offering to take me off the waiting list due to the uncertain wait time. I explained again that I have what appears to be a serious infection spreading and worsening and this was ignored and the question asked again, "would I like to be taken off of the wait list", at this point I've given up and told them to take me off the list as I could be waiting another 7/8 hours still.
 I'm now in a lot of pain and discomfort and unable to walk, and very concerned this could turn really nasty, with no way of even speaking to a duty doctor or seeing someone. 
 My only option now is to call an ambulance or find my way to AandE as I don't drive and can't walk at present because of my medical issue. 
 My nearest hospital is a 45 minute to an hour bus ride plus a big walk I'm incapable of at the other end, with no busses running through the night anyway, I am literally stuck on what to do, sat in increasing pain  at 11.30pm and no solution in sight. 
 How is it satisfactory or OK to leave someone in pain and clearly unwell with infection with no way of getting treatment?
 Not one person out of the three I spoke to actually took note of my symptoms or what the issue was, they were purely only interested in telling me how busy they were and encouraging me to take myself off of the waiting list, to ease the workload on the duty doctors.
 This service is running to a majorly unacceptable level and if I'm in this situation, I hate to think how many others are too, and even worse, how many people are going to suffer serious consequences and illness due to the lack of help here.
 Looking at the other reviews this is a recurring theme, the NHS is clearly in crisis, and at the cost of people's health and even scarier, lives.

title: Extremely unsympathetic and unhelpful
body:
This was my second attempt to access the service. The first time I was discharged after a wait of many months because I was unable to begin therapy at the point in time the therapist became available. The second time after waiting abotu a year I began cognitive analytic therapy by telephone (due to coronavirus).

In the first session I was told I would be required to specify my "goals" and I said I found this difficult owing to depression and struggling to envisage the future. In the second session the request was repeated and I repeated my difficulty. I was then told that I was not suitable for therapy and would be discharged. Because I did not wish to be left without support I said I would come up with something and offered some suggestions but the therapist said these were not valid goals and that she had made her decision and didn't have time to discuss it. This seemed especially unfair as she had begun the call 15 mins late. Throughout both sessions there was also something wrong with her phone that made communication very difficult. At my request she agreed to discuss the case with her supervisor and get back to me but all I recevied was a cursory letter re-iterating the discharge decision.

title: Lovely staff terrible planning
body: I came in for a blood test appointment and told that I have an infection so I must have c section. I was told this will be at 3pm. I am a pregnant women fasting from 8am it now next day 2am have been fasting over 17 hours but still not c section. Excuse used is emergencies happened however hospitals always will have emergencies this is the nature of hospitals but making a pregnant women wait over 17 hours and telling her she will have a c section but keeping her waiting is. It reasonable. Extremely disappointed with the service and staff communication.

title: I am sad and disappointed
body: Once the NHS was the best in the world..... We were pround. but having my UHNM orthopaedic clinic appointment again (4th time now) I must now look overseas to have consultancy, this even before the possible operation. I am in pain and embarrassed to explain that yet again '.....going back on the waiting list' What would have been nice with a phone call would have been the why....

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Unprofessional
body:
I had given birth in 2020 and have only been called about 2 times to ask if I'm doing OK, as some one who is struggling with mental health and just given birth I would of thought them to check up on me and the baby more.

When u called them with problems that the baby was having I was told my normal doctor was not in and I should call next week that's very bad for a new born to suffer because a doctor is away its not like there is no more doctors are at the gp.

Lastly the receptionist asking what the problem is when you try and make an appointment is ridiculous as sometimes it's a private problem and I have told them it's private and they still want to know this is against my rights.

title: Shambolic admin staff
body: The GPS are very good on the whole but the admin team are very disorganised.  I was given tests to take home which were already open and therefore no longer sterile, I was made to wait for nearly two hours for a scheduled appointment recently as they forgot about me (they didn’t even apologise and left it to the poor healthcare assistant to apologise even though it was the admin team’s error) and they changed my named doctor without telling me and when I very politely enquired about this they became slightly aggressive and very irritable with me.  All very unprofessional.

title: Never get an answer
body: I have rang 148 times this morning to try an get an appointment for my son he’s 4 when I ring up they always say to ring up at 8am the next day when I ring up I never get an answer an when you actually get though they end up putting the phone down on you! You put you’re repeat prescriptions in an they never get sent over to the chemist my daughter is on Prescription milk so when I ring up to say she needs it it should be sent over that day! I will be definitely leaving this doctors

title: Can never get to see a doctor
body: I have been with this surgery for many years and they were brilliant but in recent years I have been so disappointed with the service. It’s impossible to get through to make an appointment, constantly trying to ring after 8 and always the same response- you need to ring back tomorrow. Some, not all of the  reception staff are really unhelpful and you just get the impression they want you off the phone. In recent years I have relied more on the after hours dr’s who to be fair are great but I really miss having my own GP who I can see when I need to.

title: They dont exist
body: Twice said they would do a telephone appointment and both times never called me. Its like ghosts work at this practice. The doctors must just not exist I guess.

title: Terrible
body: Since Symphony took over, everything has gone down hill. Almost impossible to get an appointment. Have to wait for ages on the phone, recently I waited for 35 minutes in a queue, only to be cut off when they answered. If Symphony were on border control, no one would get into the country. Seriously thinking of changing doctors.

title: Warwick Dermatology
body: Once in the Dermatology department everything went very well.  You are informed of each step and put at ease all the way through.  One negative - do not stay outside waiting for a phone call like you are told to over the phone, go straight inside up to the second floor and wait there!  The poor gentleman before me missed his half hour by doing as he (we) were told to wait outside for a phone call to be called into the building.

title: Fantastic staff
body: On visiting the Fulwood Preston clinic for my cataract surgery may I say a big thankyou to you all. Due to my hearing problem everyone was so helpful i.e. my mask problems as I lip read. On each visit 3 in all I received excellent care and couldn’t ask for more. Thanks to all, reception through to surgeon. Your all a credit to the NHS. Thankyou

title: Great vaccine clinic
body: I was hesitant about the vaccine after a bad experience with a needle some years ago. All staff were encouraging and empathetic, and the lady that administered my vaccine couldn't have been lovelier. Kept me talking right through it!

title: Very efficient
body: Very good outpatient and minor surgery service. Nice staff. Efficient. Clean and professional. All very good

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient and helprul
body: A very helpful consultation, made easier by video call. This is a good service which is of great benefit to patients.

title: Appointment incompetence
body:
I was referred by my GP to Hepatology specialist on 29th January 2021.  On 11th May 2021 an appointment letter was received by me for consultation on 5th August 2021.  On Thursday evening 29th July I received a text message, and I quote,”we would like to inform you that your appointment has been cancelled” (like)!!!!
On Saturday 31st July I received 2 separate letters from the Outpatients Administration Team - one telling me that a recent (!!!) referral request from my GP had been received for an appointment with Hepatology (29th January is not recent).  The second letter is almost unbelievable- addressed to the Parent/Guardian of Myself.  I am almost 74 years old and my parents passed away some years ago. This letter explained that the appointment had been cancelled.
I have attempted to contact the department quoted on the letters this morning without success. Long recorded message then left holding.  I would like to know why my appointment has been cancelled and when I can expect to see a consultant. I had no specific symptoms when first referred in January as the problem was identified via blood tests and scans, but unfortunately I do now.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Waste of time
body:
Went on to 111 online Sunday afternoon 5pm was told I needed to see a doctor and someone would call in the next 12hours!!
Spent the rest of the day being sick and unable to move with the pain
By 9am the next day they still hadn’t called me so contacted had to wait for my GP to contact me instead!!

title: Uncaring
body:
I was admitted to the ward in the middle of the night and left in bed in my clothes until morning.
No one introduced themselves to me.
I found the different colours of uniform bewildering and was not sure who I was talking to.
The staff were uncaring and on one occasion decidedly rude. This was when I was unable to wash myself and one member of staff told a more senior one that I didn’t want one.
Since I came home, I notice that I had been given more of one tablet than my prescription says, not enough of others and none of one particular one. I was never told what tablets I was being given and I do know what I normally take and when.
I observed that people who needed help or encouragement to eat were not helped and very often their food was untouched.
I know that the nursing staff have been under great pressure but they seem to have lost the caring attitude that I remember.
There seems little dignity and respect for the elderly in this hospital and sadly in many others across the NHS

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor in every respect.
body: You absolutely cannot deal with this practice via phone or email. The response varies from poor to non existent. When you do get there the feeling of being 'farmed' is very prevalent.

title: Appalling
body: Rang over 300 times. Then in queue for 45 mins to be told no appointments and don’t care attitude and phone slammed down. Disgusting! Just drop dead before this surgery will give you any care or an appointment.

title: Good health care, let down by incredibly rude…
body:
I have been a patient of this surgery, and its predecessors, for over 46 years and can say without hesitation that the current administrative staff are, by far, the rudest I have ever encountered during this time.

Their manner is curt and unhelpful and they give the impression that dealing with your enquiry is an inconvenience or burden, rather than their function. 

Unfortunately, I have had reason to contact my GP more in the last 12 months, than at any other time in my life and, almost without exception, I have been left stunned by the sheer lack of basic courtesies from the reception staff. To the extent, that I now use the e-consult system exclusively to avoid speaking with them.

If I were the Practice Manager, I would take note that this seems to be a recurring theme amongst reviewers.

title: Terrible
body: After two months since registration I'm going to a new GP. Unfriendly staff since the first call. When I went for a consultation the receptionist wouldn't answer simple questions about the other consultation that was canceled and about my contact details which were wrong. I had a phone appointment last week and stayed home the whole afternoon, by the phone, because they were supposed to call me anytime within a 4 hour time frame, but I got no call. They are not helpful at all and I prefer going to a GP that's an hour away rather than stressing every time I need something. Worst GP I've ever had.

title: Terrible practice procedures
body: The surgery have made it almost impossible to make an advance appointment. You are told to ring at 8am and if you ring later you cannot make an appointment in advance for any other day. The system is unkind and inhumane. Whilst GPs are busy they should still treat their patient with respect. I do not know why the GPs feel able to treat their patients like this. It is sad that they seem to have lost their humanity and professional values.

title: Couldn't care less
body: Attended this morning for my appointment for knee consultation, only to be told that the clinic had been cancelled. It seems that everyone but the patient was made aware of this, apparently they don't have staff to inform patients of cancellation. Had to take time off for the appointment, wasn't allowed pass the entrance doorway and was asked to communicate from standing in the doorway. No real apology, empathy or remorse, just a lousy excuse as to reason for no prior communication.

title: Wouldn’t recommend
body: I called today can’t have a phone conversation till18th August then followed up after that if they believe necessary

title: Exemplary care and reassurance
body:
A strange rash associated with atypical symptoms prompted my GP colleague to recommend that I attend ED for a blood test. 
From the Triage nurse reception staff, the clinician who took blood and recorded an ECG, the cleaning staff who worked in the waiting room during my 3hours of watching what ED staff have to tolerate from members of the public and finally the consultant who reassured me that my bloods were normal. Everyone should be proud of the safety and care they provide in these trying times.
My rash spread all over during the following days, but knowing that my bloods were normal enabled me to sleep soundly.
Thank you to all those whose professionalism was evident.
I apologise to the consultant who thought I was wasting valuable time in the ED, but access to services in primary care are challenging.
Keep up the good work

title: Worst practice ever
body:
6 days without medication for epilepsy because my doctor miscalculation.for days I am trying to get someone on the phone but unfortunately without luck. Not to mention that they cut my calls as soon as I ask name of the doctor responsible for this. 
I will definitely raise a complaint about this case. 
And ladies on information desk could get some training how to talk to people kindly. Appalling service.

title: Awful receptionists
body: This surgery does not care about people and do not go out of their way to be helpful or to do the right thing. You are just a number to them, I have had to call this surgery 2 or 3 times a week for the last year just to get simple things done. The they they speak to people is unacceptable, you are made to feel like a nuisance or a hassle and I am simply fed up with the place. I pay for as much as I can afford privately to avoid this horror show of a doctor’s surgery. I will say though there is one GP (who I cannot name or my review will be reject) who is fantastic, BGMP do not deserve someone who is thoughtful, kind and clever as he is, the best part is that he knows that the place is an absolute nonsense and apologises for it.

title: Amazing hospital
body: I came into st michaels on 30th July for mpfl ligament reconstruction and a tibial tubercle distillation on my knee. I can’t praise this hospital enough especially during these tough times. I stayed for 2 nights in st Joseph’s ward and the staff are amazing, they looked after me so well and the anethatist really put me at ease and was so caring, the physios were incredible and a good laugh, the surgeon was very polite and helpful and the nurses were out of this world, thank you st michaels for looking after me and making this painful surgery more comfortable!

author: Par47
title: Perforated eardrum
body:
Around the end of May I had excruciating earache.  
I phoned the doctors and was given an appointment ended up seeing a practice nurse who looked in my ear and said I had an ear infection and gave me some stuff to squirt  
In it,that was on a Friday.  
Over the weekend I had really really bad earache so phoned the doctor on the Monday morning and got an appointment and saw a doctor at Par surgery in Cornwall.  
She looked in my ear and said I had an ear infection changed my medication and gave me some very strong painkillers and referred me to Treliske hospital which took about two weeks before I saw anybody.  
Bye then the infection is cleared up but I saw this wonderful lady who had this amazing machine and cleaned my ears out and discovered I had a perforated eardrum.  
Then made me an appointment to see her again in four weeks time.  
When I saw the next time I had another perforation in my eardrum bigger than before.  
Then I went to see them again today and my perforated eardrum was bigger.  
And she’s made me an appointment to be seen in October with her to see how I’m getting on.  
She has referred me to an ear nose and throat specialist but said it could be months before I saw anybody . And she might see me again in October before I even saw the specialist.  
It seems such a long and drawn out business and I’m quite deaf in my left ear.  
The ladies at the hospital were absolutely brilliant and they have this wonderful machine I just feel that I’m never going to get this thing sorted out why does it all take so long.  
Just for the record I’m a 74-year-old man in normal good health

title: Worse gp ever
body: I call this morning for an appointment and they told me I have to register again because they took me and my family out . I should have been inform about this , or able to keep my space in that gp, right ? When I ask for explanation the receptionist just cut me off . We been registered there from the last 3 years and is never easy to go along with them , very rude and unprofessional staff!

title: Totally Unsatisfactory Service
body:
I am writing this review as I am extremely unhappy about the unsatisfactory service that I received as a patient of this practice.  
- waiting times to get through on the telephone 45-60 mins (call queues continually high levels even at different times of the day.  I experienced being 20th and then again 26th in queue).
- abrupt and rude reception staff who answer the call.  No good morning/afternoon or even a polite hello Forest Gate Surgery, just "patients name and date of birth".
- explained the issue which would fall in the category of requiring an appointment due to the nature of health issue but was told that only a telephone triage would be available even though the condition would not be able to be assessed remotely.
- telephone triage will not be acceptable for those patients that work in industries where they are not at a base and move around during the day or work in environments where it would be difficult to speak privately.  
- No empathy to this issue by the receptionist - informed this is the only option and suggested to go to the Royal South Hants Hospital for minor injuries even though it was not an injury but a possible cancer lump! 
I did not make an appointment and was left tearful, frustrated and totally shocked at the appalling service.  I am now fearful of falling ill and requiring help as this service provider is totally failing it's patients.  I just hope that my concerns along with other patients of this practice will be addressed by the Health Service Ombudsman.

title: Phone lines too busy to connect
body: 02/08/2021 so far I’ve been trying to call for the last 3 hours and 45 mins… 25+ attempts to call… and I haven’t been able to connect once… phone lines are too busy!

title: Lack of communication
body: I did a online consultation on Monday 26th July, to be told I would be contacted by 6.30pm Tuesday, this didn’t happen, I got a message the next day to say I would be contacted within the next 3 to 5 working days,i phoned the surgery on day 4 (2nd August)for a update to be told I should have gone to the treatment centre, however I wasn’t informed l had to do that,I needed a sick note, which they wouldn’t give me as I hadn’t been to treatment centre,if I had known i would have gone.

title: What a Waste of time
body:
this Surgery service getting worst day by day. Firstly they do not book an appointment and they direct everyone to Dr. IQ apps which is not working. My wife calling last few days to get her regular medication which we have to wait on call for more than an hour every day but had no success. 

this is totally waste of time. 

we tried to get an appointment for my son but no success. they did not took my son situation seriously and we are end up with near by A&E.

title: Very bad service
body: Tired to book an appointment twice and no doctor called back. Staff are extremely rude. When you try to call the surgery they put you on hold for ages.

title: Shambles of a surgery
body: Tried to contact them for a prescription as its a very important medication and to speak to a doctor due to other issues. Called so many times for the phone to just ring and ring and ring, I know there's an online system which when I go on to the website is no longer available so I can't reach them via phone or website. Even got a family member to call or get on to website thinking it might be my mistake but nothing at all! Ridiculous place

title: From AMAZING to WORST in a matter of months
body: I have been with the Gower Street Practice for the last 13 years and it's been amazing in terms of customer service and expertise. Within a matter of months, due to changing of partners and reception staff, the quality has gone downhill. It's literally impossible to get an appointment with a doctor and the reception staff lacks customer service. As I had my first first Covid vaccine dose abroad, on 119 advice, I sent my proof of first vaccine to the practice. As it's still not showing on the NHS side, 119 advised that I checked with my GP that the information has been placed correctly in the system. The practice manager said that t it wouldn't show in the system as the first dose was administered abroad which is incorrect. When I asked I would be able to get my Covid Pass if the first dose was not in the system, the practice manager was completely unaware of what the Covid Pass was. As I need to get my dose of vaccine earlier that 8 weeks for work reason, 119 asked me to get it booked through my GP but my GP doesn't book vaccines and does not write letters for us to have the second dose earlier, despite all other doctors do that. My colleagues and friends had this done by their GPs. I requested an urgent appointment to discuss this as well as because I have a mole that worries me as it's become painful but the practice manager said it wasn't urgent as asked me to fill in a long online assessment form. Only one of the original doctors is still working at the practice since the practice has been taken over and all patients are now booking with this particular doctor as they are unhappy with the other doctors. For this reason this particular doctor is overwhelmed with work while the partners do not do very much. It's a terrible situation and I would not recommend you join this GP practice.

author: I dont exist
title: Treatment (lack of)
body: Presented at A& E at NMGH 11. 00 am Monday with large internal bleed. Admitted approx 23. 00hrs, fasting with view to scope on Tuesday, never happened! ! Fasted and put on drip again Tuesday night in prep for scope on Wednesday, never happened- cut to the chase: - I’m not on a gastro ward, despite a lot of requests and promises I have NOT seen anyone from the ‘gastro team’ to discuss/treat my issue since being admitted; - over120hours now! ! ! ! All I’ve had is bloods taken and visits from the respiratory Drs on the ward I have been put on. Abysmal! ! ! ! !

author: Mason06
title: My inspirational son
body:
Just over 6 years ago our son was born with 24 hour complex nursing needs, which all came unknown during pregnancy and nothing could have prepared us for our future ahead at that time. From the moment our precious boy was born our world changed in so many ways.  
As parents we quickly learnt the medical world, equipment, medicines, careplans, appointments, but mostly we learnt and appreciated with everything those smiling faces who helped give us reassurance, taught us a new precious way of seeing life from a nursing view and in general with so much positivity and helped us see the light even on dark days.  
As a parent with a child with complex needs, our world can at times feel lonely and a constant learning curve which at times can be scary with new things always coming our way, but when we were introduced to our amazing children's community nursing team in Lurgan we felt as parents like we had extended our own wee family home with the devotion and sincere help day or night given to us when needed, may it be a simple phone call to see how we all are, but most importantly of all our son.  
He just adores all the team within the community nurses which just means the world to us as parents because when he's happy we are all happy. The community nursing team really are super heroes to us all year round. We have met forever friends who go above and beyond when we need help and support and with this amazing team your always guaranteed 110%for there hard work all year round. Our family are forever grateful and thankful for there continued hard work and most importantly of all we are so happy to have met forever friends with them all 🙂

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Sadie P
title: My recent stay in st marys
body:
On Wednesday I visited st marys as I was feeling unwell I visited the urgent treatment center following on from a 111 call, I had some bloods and then discharged but I then received a phone call to say I had to come back due to some bloods not being normal.  
On my arrival back to the urgent treatment center, I was spoken to very rudely by the receptionist who unfortunately I didn't get their name - however the Healthcare assistant was so pleasant and caring and showed such a caring approach despite me feeling very emotional and in such pain and feeling stressed I was then taken to another ward where I was waiting for a bed on a Ward, again nothing but such a care approach.  
I was then admitted to luccombe Ward where the staff were extremely kind, helpful and nothing was a problem the trainee nurse called ruby was absolutely fantastic, the Healthcare assistant called Sophie was very kind and showed all the patients In my bay G bay kind, caring and understanding support and never rushed a patient while they was talking it was so nice to see.  
Also the sister who I'm led to believe is Heidi was so lovely, supporting her staff and helping out also, I felt like nothing was to much trouble even if I rang the bell, the nurse staff were very prompt with the pain relief and kept me up to speed with all on what was happening if they didn't know they would ask. The cleaner Allen did a fantastic job to keep the ward to a high standard and so pleasant to talk too also.  
I just want to ensure that the staff get the praise for their hard outstanding work on the ward because the deserve it and also for someone as young and scared as me they did a fantastic job. I know hospital are not a pleasant stay for the reason you're there because you're unwell but this was a experience that couldn't have gone better despite me never being in hospital.

author: foxtrotwh45
title: Wheelchair repair.
body: My electric six-wheeled wheelchair required to be repaired as the foot rests had been accidentally damaged. Once reported to WestMARC, the repair was speedily carried out. An engineer from the Yoker, Glasgow depot of WestMARC attended my fairly remote, rural property. I cannot commend his work highly enough. He could not have been more thorough, and gave helpful advice regarding safe operation of my chair in future. Excellent service!

readBy.name: Office of Jackie Baillie, MSP for Dumbarton

author: LucyOlly
title: I was assessed, treated and transferred to hospital by NIAS
body:
Katy and Chris were the paramedics and they were fantastic to myself and my daughters who were so worried.  
They were both calm, professional, reassuring and brilliant at their jobs. But it was more than that. They both went the extra mile. I will never forget their care and attention. Thankyou.

author: errandrr63
title: Attendance for a blood test
body:
The nurse was lovely and I had a really long chat with her.
I was trying to be sensible about my sexual health and she reassured me that I was doing the right thing and that I should come back regularly, saying ‘we all go to the dentist when we don’t have tooth ache so why not come here? ! ’
I ended up having a full MOT and intend to do the same again on a regular basis.
There is still a stigma with attending sexual health clinics unfortunately. The fact that my details don’t go to my GP also reassured me.

author: n45ryan
title: Speech Therapy
body:
I will be forever grateful for the amazing therapy my son received from Justin in Lurgan Hospital Speech and Language Unit. Justine and her unique therapy gave my son his voice and changed his life.  
My son attended twice weekly therapy for 2 years and the difference it has made has been incredible.  
Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: Lucky57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I wish they would explain things in simple terms
body:
I have been in the Trauma ward for a few days and although my care has been excellent and I couldn't wish for better staff, the food is dreadful. I don't think it is suitable for hospital food as it is always cold when it gets to me.  
The staff on the ward do everything for you immediately if you ask and they are just so friendly. The ward is kept spotlessly clean and I have been comfortable here.  
The issue is that when the doctors are talking to me about my care and treatment, they often use complicated language and so I am not always clear on what is actually happening and I am often left confused. I don't think it is impressive that they know these big fancy words, I just want it in simple terms so I know what is happening.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lucky57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I just need a little bit more help
body:
I have been in 1 East for a number of days now and the staff are lovely. Everything is very clean and I am comfortable as is possible. I really can't complain about this ward I'm on but I am visually impaired and I sometimes would like more help with things like eating my dinner or even being told what is on my plate because quite often my dinner is just given to me and I have to just eat it without seeing it.  
Sometimes I am left waiting for things I ask for but I understand that the ward is very busy so it is hard to keep everyone happy all the time!  
Apart from this I have had no problems with any staff members or with any facilities. They have been great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Hard to be by myself to manage the baby
body: My experience has been fantastic.   The girls in the delivery suite were amazing and kept me at ease.   It is sad that my partner wasn't allowed into induction etc.   It was very hard coming up to this ward straight after delivery, feeling very drowsy  to be by myself to manage my baby.   Even one more  hour of my partner being allowed in would be  beneficial as the hour goes by so fast.   This is a lovely and quiet ward.   The staff here would  help  me if I need it.   In my opinion, there is a lack of staff.   There are only 2 midwives on the ward today so they're very busy.   I was told that my baby was getting checks done 1. 5 hours ago but I'm still waiting for them to do it.   I understand that they have many people to look after.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Aldo77
title: Cancelled surgery
body:
Cancelled  
Yesterday I had my surgery cancelled. I understand these things happen ... my problem is I am in significant pain and this was something I have been needing to get sorted for a number of years and delayed of course due to the pandemic . I don't like to complain, but I don't know what to do.  
My gp has signed me off, but when I was cancelled I wasn't given much information in terms of time scale, what do, how to keep informed of what is happening.. I'm not in the business of blame, I just want clarity .... I also feel that I always seem to have chase my care up. Just because its elective doesn't mean we aren't struggling  
I accept we are in a difficult time. But I just need more information

author: bluenk88
title: An overall good experience
body:
Over my lifetime I have been in hospital on many occasions, with my first trip to Daisy Hill Hospital being at the age of 5. Over the years, I have had many good experiences as well as bad. Thankfully, my most recent stay has been excellent.  
After being referred to a consultant through my GP, a bed was made available for me up on the female medical ward. I was so very happy and glad to have gotten the bed - as well as very grateful for the fact I was examined and seen so very quickly.All the staff have been super -they are just so very kind and explain everything. I would like to specially mention my doctor. She explained everything so very clearly - she made sure to use terminology that I would understand and she really could not have been any nicer to me.Having had many hospital experiences, I can happily say that the food is so much better than it used to be which I am very grateful for.All the nurses which have been involved in my care up on the female medical ward have shown such kindness and I am yet to meet somebody who has been in anyway unpleasant.The only thing that I find a shame is that you don't get to see the doctor at the weekends, so you have to wait until the Monday morning to receive a proper update as to how things are progressing. However, I am entirely understanding that the Doctors also need a break.Overall, my recent stay in Daisy Hill Hospital's Female Medical Ward has been a positive one and all the staff should be commended.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: julynon1990
title: My hospital stay at the Beatson
body:
I have Aspergers and was unfortunate to receive a diagnosis of a Germ Cell Tumour. I attended my GP who immediately referred me to the surgical dept at IRH. This was a scary experience for me as I was socially not able to cope with all these people asking me questions over and over, I was so scared.  
I was referred to the Beatson for review. This is where I met the amazing Dr White. He was not supposed to see me that day but to my amazing luck he filled in for another Dr who was off. His Registrar Lena and specialist nurse Colleen were also there. At first I thought more strange faces. This is when I found out what my diagnosis was and I was devastated but they were amazing. Dr White was clear spoken and honest. I found a huge sense of trust in him and his team. He arrange for my admission and allowed my mum to stay with me. Two days later i arrived at Ward B4, Lesley and her team were so kind to me and understood my challenges with my Aspergers.  
From February till July I was an inpatient on and off in Ward B4. I had complications but Dr White and his team addressed these immediately. Throughout my treatment I was reassured by all the staff nursing and medical.  
Dr White gave me a chart he made to allow me to see the progress of my tumour markers decreasing. ( im quite a visual person so this was great). He always took the time to ask me what I felt was important to me and he genuinely cared.  
Im now on the next part of my journey and about to be admitted to the GRI for surgery. Dr White and Colleen have ensured this transition will be smooth for me.  
I'm lucky that I can get back to see Dr White and his team for follow up, but I can't thank him enough for all he has done for me to date.

author: Clairelayla
title: Foot ulcer
body:
My foot had a bad ulcer, my local doctor had been prescribing antibiotics for more than 10wks and the foot wasn’t healing, my daughter took photos every day and was sending them to the surgery, after the 3rd or 4th picture the doctor had realised how bad it actually was, I could not walk or put any type of pressure on the foot and had been suffering for months before  
I was referred to podiatrist at the shankill well-being centre, I have been seen by Ivor, Connor and bronagha, sorry if names are incorrectly spelled, they have done a brilliant job getting my foot back to a healthy state. They where very quick at seeing me and dealing with me, referrals to hospital and small stint operation all thanks to the quick thinking of the podiatrist doctors, my foot has fully healed and is healthy again and I would really like to give thanks to these 3 podiatry doctors, and everyone else but mostly podiatry ❤️

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Footman
title: Excellent Podiatry Treatment
body:
I'd like to publicly recognise the excellent treatment I received from Alicia, one of the podiatrists at the Bradbury Health and Care Centre in Belfast. Alicia was warm, friendly and positive throughout. What really impressed me was that she took time at the start to read through all of my previous notes, which made me feel she had a full grip on all that she needed to know about me before treating me.  
During treatment of my feet, Alicia listened carefully to the information I was giving her and acted accordingly, so as to avoid any of the injuries I had suffered from previous visits to other podiatrists at the same practice. When Alicia finished, it was clear that I had received superb treatment to both my feet. I salute Alicia and thank her for the genuine care and expert professionalism she demonstrated throughout my visit.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jeannien81
title: Cataract Surgery
body:
I had cataract surgery at Ayr Hospital this week. I was very apprehensive about it but need not have worried. Dc Varacara and his team were excellent and made me feel at ease  
The surgery went well and is a success as my sight is very much improved  
Thank you so much to Dc Varacara and all the nurses.

author: staggieinthehighlands
title: Endoscopy
body:
Have complex stomach problems and a regular visitor to the Endoscopy suite at Raigmore. On every occasion I'm always welcomed. I'm a fairly nervous patient however from the reception team to the nursing staff and to Dr Gunjaca. This man seriously is amazing. I'm really luck to have Dr Gunjaca and Mr Tamijmarane looking after me.  
Having any kind of scope is daunting but was made to feel at ease. I almost feel like the team are more like friends i've not seen in a while.  
A huge thanks especially to Amanda (Nurse) and Arlene (Charge Nurse) for their perseverance trying to get a canula inserted. If there's an email to reach them or the service manager please let me know as I would like to write to them and thank them.

author: warmwx54
title: Midwives extremely nice and very very caring
body: I have had a very good experience in the Maternity Ward at Daisy Hill. The midwives are all extremely nice and very very caring - I honestly could not ask for better from the staff - you are all doing an excellent job even with the immense pressure and strain you are facing. My only problem is that I really want to go home - I have been in a long time now but I trust the doctor's and midwives know what they're doing. The restrictive visiting in place due to COVID-19 has also made things more difficult, but other than this I am happy about my stay here - everything has been very good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: augustpd39
title: A 10/10 experience!
body: My time in Daisy Hill Hospital's Maternity Ward has been nothing short of excellent.   The midwives have been absolutely great - super friendly and caring - I feel as though I am being extremely well looked after.   The facilities themselves are all fab - incredibly clean which I very much like. I honestly have no complaints about my time here - if I was to rate it I would give all the staff a fantastic 10/10.   A big well done and thank you!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Gjh17
title: Great service provided by all in max fax dept!
body:
I was seen by many doctors, nurses, HSCW and admin team within the max fax dept. I was referred with my top two wisdom teeth bothering me. I seen Dr Vuity who was lovely and helpful and asked for me to have an OPT xray prior to my clinic appointment, which imaging kindly squeezed me in within their busy department. Then I got referred for me to get them out.  
I received an appointment a few weeks later and it was a lovely doctor named Alyson (didn’t pick up surname) and her team who removed the two teeth in two separate visits. She was so polite, friendly and extremely good at her job. I would just like to thank all the team again for the wonderful job you all do :-)

author: Drl jackson
title: Waiting times in a&e
body: Attended A& E at ulster hospital- simple treatment required to get a couple of stitches in a head cut.   Health board website showed average wait time of 111 minutes throughout the time I was there. In fact I Waited over 6 hours without treatment before eventually leaving at 02. 45 am actually seeing a doctor or nurse practitioner.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: aurigafm63
title: Implant removal and reinsertion
body: The ladies at the clinic were so kind and helpful. The nurse was extremely gentle with me when the implant was removed and reinserted. She was also really helpful in answering questions I had about the menopause. I will definitely use the clinic again as I received an empathetic and caring service from the clinic. I cannot fault the care I received today - it was outstanding.

author: mcduffsunshine
title: My pre-assessment experience and my stay in the ward
body:
I attended for my pre-assessment at the stated time, information and guidance to the appropriate department was given by the reception staff at the entrance to the hospital.  
On arrival I waited a few minutes and was then approached by a nurse who introduced herself and explained the procedures that she would be undertaking. She put me at my ease as we chatted about various things unrelated to the appointment and at the end the time scale for my surgical procedure was given to me.  
It was an uneventful, informative appointment and I left feeling that I had been treated exceptionally well.  
I received a letter the next week giving me a date for my Cholecystectomy which was within 14 days of my pre assessment appointment giving me advice on what I should do etc the day before.  
On the day of my operation I was directed to the day theatre and although the staff were friendly enough I felt a bit like I was in a cattle market, there were so many people being prepped for theatre.  
Again I did not have to wait long my personal belongings were stored safely for me and I was escorted into the anaesthetic room where I was informed of what would be happening and they helped me get comfortable on the trolley before administering the anaesthetic.  
I woke up in a ward where I was given a jug of water and was asked to drink as much as I could. I was treated well and the staff were considerate and attentive.  
I was woken two hourly overnight for observations and in the morning the night staff who were finishing their shift placed a glass of water on my table. Night staff weren't so friendly and I got the impression that they couldn't wait to end their shift as they rushed to get finished.  
All in all though the staff and particularly the lady surgeon who performed my operation were friendly , knowledgeable and kind.

author: venusgk83
title: Bowel screening
body:
I recently completed a bowel screening test which showed blood in my stool. I received the results within days of submitting the test together with the appropriate paperwork detailing what would happen next.  
A few days later I received a telephone call from one of the bowel screening staff nurses who went through exactly what would happen next and was given an appointment for my colonoscopy. Given the current situation I had expected that I would have to wait for some time for this. I was delighted to be given an appointment within 2 weeks. I arranged to have a covid test appointment 3 days before the procedure.  
On arrival at Queen Margaret Hospital for my examination, I was greeted by exceptionally helpful staff who took me to the Endoscopy Unit where I was greeted by a lovely receptionist who was very reassuring. I was then seen by one of the nurses who went through in detail what would happen next. The Consultant then saw Ms and explained in further detail the process.  
On changing and going to the examination room where I was greeted by yet more helpful and reassuring staff. The examination was completed and the results discussed. On arrival in recovery further checks were carried out before I received tea and toast. The whole experience was amazing from start to finish, particularly given the awful strains on our NHS at the moment. I would like to express my gratitude to all concerned. Our NHS is amazing. Many thanks from a very grateful patient.

author: famc
title: Orthopaedic after care
body:
Experiencing issues with wound . Allergic response to dressings developing a rash and blisters on and around the wound. The associated itch and discomfort was intense. Concerned with a possibility of an increased risk for wound infection I phoned the ward for advice. They had a few suggestions most of which I had already tried with no improvement and continued symptoms. Unfortunately ANP was not available when I called.  
On their advice i emailed my GP with photos and asked them to contact me with advice. The Staff Nurse also said if no improvment I could call next day after 9am to speak to the ANP. Friday morning I was really struggling with the discomfort and becoming increasingly concerned re the impact on healing. With no response from my GP and knowing highly unlikely i would get a same day appointment, i contacted the ward to speak to ANP.  
They cleary understood my anxieties over infection risk, the distress symptoms and discomfort in wound were causing me. The ANP arranged for me to attend to have a wound review. After examination and cleaning of the wound and the blistering, the reassurance they were able to give was hughly beneficial.  
The GPs receptionist did call late afternoon with a message from Dr to make an appointment with the Nurse so, as I had anticipated the likelihood is I would have continued to experience dreadful discomfort and worry over the weekend. The receptionist was informed I had already attended the hospital.  
Thank you to Staff Nurse and the Trainee ANP for their understanding and support provided. Advice on wound and antihistamines has meant a much more comfortable evening and night. I just wish the GP had contacted me saving a trip to hospital.

author: skypx73
title: My visit to Arbroath hospital
body: After phoning 111 and speaking to helper I was put through to staff who phoned me back and gave me an appointment with the hospital. All done very efficiently and speed. I can’t thank the staff at the hospital enough.

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership

author: apuswk87
title: Virtual meeting with my best friend in Daisyhill
body: I was connected with my friend a little after 7. 00pm at Daisyhill Hospital and we were able to talk and I was able to reassure her that she was in the best place for her recovery I feel that the service provided by Southern Health & Social Trust is amazing and being able to see each other made both of us feel so much better, it is an invaluable service and it should be continued indefinitely for the well being of all the patients and family members and friends, who can benefit from talking and seeing their loved ones. Truly amazing service - thank you to all those involved and well done, keep up this incredible service.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Bad at communicating and for forgetting me.
body:
Arrived early for 7:30am. 
Brilliant and pleasantly surprised because I was seen to straight away then showed to my bed on ward 31. 
About a 6 hour wait for my surgery before I had that seen to. The ‘morning staff was so kind and helpful and busy trying to see to everything so well done staff 👍👏🏻. 
I then met the lovely surgeon who explained clearly with respect and genuinely help full with articulacy when describing what is going to be done in the operation so I’m clear. I highly recommend him and the morning staff. 
The lunch time/afternoon staff were waiting for someone to come with a form for me to sign after I ate and drank fluids, also if I could walk which I could for definite. 
Dozens of times I queried if I could go home as directed in my preassesment and suggested in the appointment letter. 6pm came, still no food, very hungry from fasting night before but the nurse politely said they’ve stopped serving hot food now. Earlier I placed my order off the menu too. 
She was nice and kind because she gave me a selection to choose from with a cake, crisps and a green banana 😑😆. 
8pm came still no joy after asking 3 more times when can I go home? When 9pm or near there came,  a nurse who I asked if she was angry with me explained that the notes came late and there’s no one to do it now so I’ll have to stay in. 
I mentioned that she was hurting me when she pressed to hard so I firmly stopped the blood from the drip needle that had been left in 9 hours.  It was a full drip bag that had been full for at least nine hours and a injection needle in both front of hands that could had been removed hours back by what I gathered. 
I ended up discharging myself because I was supposed to had gone home earlier and my friend who collected me tonight couldn’t drive me home the following day . 
The staff clearly did not communicate with one another and it was obvious I was forgotten about or ignored maybe! 
It made my other condition separate to the procedure I had done worse and I was feeling pretty ill from it. I missed my other dose of tablets because I was told wrong that I couldn’t take my other non painkillers too. 
I also asked the young nurse if I could take my two strong painkillers earlier but she said no. 
The nine o clock nurse said why havnt I taken any tablets, have you got them with you? I replied yes but the nurse shook her head and said no I couldn’t take any 😖. 
My last operation stay was much better at the other hospital for the aftercare. 
Please write notes on reception desk for the afternoon/evening staff to read. If done please afternoon evening staff “read” and double check and not leave patients hungry for hours and distressed for cause to complain. 😔
Thank you for taking the time to read this.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust
